website_summaries.verdict: Buyers seeking a taller learning stool for their older children should check out this popular active chair.
pros: Option to purchase in a number of varying heights and colors
Rubber, non-slip bottom allows for ultimate tilting and rolling without tipping over
Strengthens children's core muscles and posture
cons: Not the most durable option, especially in classroom settings

customer_reviews.title: Compare favorably against Hokki stools
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a sample before an elementary school library remodel to compare with hokki stools. We've had two 12 inch and two 15 inch hokki stools for a year, and I purchased one 18 inch Learniture active learning stool a couple of weeks ago. I asked my second and third graders to sit on them both and compare, not exchanging information until I asked them 15 minutes later. The consensus is that these stools are more comfortable that the hokki stools, even though they don't wobble as much. I love it, as these are about 1/3 of the price! Win for my school library and the kiddos!
customer_reviews.author: Amy T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all kids and classrooms.  Teachers need to have these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a local elementary school. I asked the teachers what they could use most in their class, and over and over again I heard "wobble chairs"!!! I think I have purchased around 30 of these chairs now. They are a great solid addition to the classroom. The students love them, the teachers love them, and I was able to get many more chairs for the money than the other ones I found. The teachers have said they have really helped children with ADHD another learning disabilities be able to focus on their learning. BEST Product and an amazing price.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Sell

customer_reviews.title: Great for classrooms!!
customer_reviews.text: These wobble stools are amazing. I teach middle school, and my students all want to sit on them! They are much more stable than the pricier versions. Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: love the rubber on the bottom. I have some from a more popular brand and they slip everywhere, including out from under the students and wear down the wax on the floor. But....these are great, not as wobbly, but wobbly enough. Plus they don't slid, not as easy to tip, and they don't tear up the floor. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay McAwesomepants

customer_reviews.title: Students LOVE them but poor adhesive
customer_reviews.text: I have a class set of these stools. My students love them, however, I'm disappointed in the quality. After having the stools for only 3 months, 8 are have issues with the cushion coming apart from the seat area. The adhesive needs to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Good for fidgety kid, but took a while to convince
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who was 3'11" when I bought it and is now 4'. Height is just right. He's super fidgety and can't sit still typically. At first, he really didn't like it. It took some convincing to even try it, but now he prefers it over his regular chair. I really like how it arrived as one piece vs. another similar chair that arrived in multiple pieces. This has a lot sturdier construction. I like the padding on the bottom, too, which other similar chairs lack. I'd buy this again and easily recommend it to others. The only question is if your kid will give it a try or not.
customer_reviews.author: Customer X

customer_reviews.title: My children love this stool and I have four in the public ...
customer_reviews.text: My children love this stool and I have four in the public school system. Most of the teachers were on board with allowing my children to use this. I had a few I had to push to allow them to use these. I would love for the seller to contact me so I can get a price quote for an entire class room.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Windham

customer_reviews.title: Useful -Movement Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I use this all over the house - and outside. For my computer desk downstairs - for my drawing desk up stairs (so lightweight it can be carried anywhere) - for sitting at the kitchen table reading recipes - for sitting for 15 minutes outside in the sun. Tempted to try it in the shower for the fun of it. When the health advice of the times is to keep moving you couldn't find a better device for doing that when you are seated.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great for wiggly kids
customer_reviews.text: My ASD son wiggles and tips his chairs back constantly. This stool allows him to wiggle a little easier and keeps him from tipping back and falling over so much. I got the tallest one, he uses it at the kitchen table. It was a bit overpriced, but it's been a good buy nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality !!!
customer_reviews.text: this is a good quality wobble chair for home or the classroom. It comes in one piece and looks and feels heavy duty. It has a rubberized base so there is no slipping and sliding on smooth flooring. I like this model better than the KORE chairs for classroom use as they allow wobbling but no spinning and the rubberized bottom prevents sliding. The seating surface is also rubberized/no slip which is great. The kids love these chairs! I am sure these chairs will last - they are heavy duty!
customer_reviews.author: jazzfan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and just as good
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these stools for my classroom. I've had them for about six months and they are working great. They are a good, cheaper alternative to the Hokki stools that I already had. They rock a little less but other than that, there is no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL Wobble Stools
customer_reviews.text: My students and I LOVE these stools. Just wish they weren’t so expensive. They’ve held up nicely and my students can’t wait for their turn to sit on one. They wobble just the right amount and they are comfortable to sit in all day. I even like using one (after school of course, because my students would fight me for one during the day. LOL!) Wish I had enough $$$ to buy a whole classroom set!! We have one other brand of wobble stool in our classroom, but my Learniture stools are always the first picked for the day!
customer_reviews.author: Chris T.

customer_reviews.title: While technically the height works well with my middle school ...
customer_reviews.text: While technically the height works well with my middle school tables, the stool is too small for many of my students. I passed this on to my husband to use in a second-grade class, and it has transformed the behavior of the student to whom he has it assigned. Seems to be holding up well. Four stars rather than five due to the price for what is essentially a plastic stool.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable lightweight stool for fidgety sitters
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 18" stool to fit under a small desk and tuck out of the way when not in use. The wobble feature is fun for fidgety people but isn't too unstable - it never feels like you will fall off. The 18" height works for me (5'5") as well as my 8 year old. The black one doesn't look too obviously like children's furniture - I barely notice it when it's pushed under the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: He said he sits on it for a good part of his day
customer_reviews.text: Our PTO has bought several of these for some of the teachers at school. My husband actually requested this one for use at work. He said he sits on it for a good part of his day. He is one who has trouble siting still in a traditional office chair so this works well for him. Tucks nicely under his desk when he's ready to sit still.
customer_reviews.author: ChristieS

customer_reviews.title: Great stool!
customer_reviews.text: We love this stool! It is great for getting out wiggled, while sitting. It fits neatly under the desk, unlike other flexible seating options we’ve used. It is light, easy to clean, and seems sturdy. I will be waiting to see how it holds up with regular use. I think I will be looking for a way to purchase more of them for my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lopez

customer_reviews.title: My 6th Graders Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to try out because I was curious. I have quite the variety of shapes and sizes in my class, so I really didn't know how it would hold up. It is perfect! It is very sturdy and it's THE CHAIR to have in class. I've even snatched it a few times myself to sit on it. The wobbling motion is fantastic for those kids that need to be moving themselves at all times. I'm hoping to eventually order more of these!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Day

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chicago  Kindergarten class
customer_reviews.text: I bought 8 of these to donate to my kids' kindergarten class. The teachers and kids love them. My twins both fidget and these have improved their focus and that of other bouncy kids in the class. Update: These have really held up well in a classroom setting. None are broken all look almost new.
customer_reviews.author: Beata

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: These have become favorite seats in my fourth grade classroom. They don’t scuff the tile floor which is an extra bonus. They have held up well after two years-added more after the first year- this is my second purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S.C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality! I used two of them in my classroom for the whole year and they are still in one piece. I have seen other brands and this is by far the most sturdy and durable. If anything will fail on these stools it would probably bee the middle gray part, it is soft (for sitting purposes) but I can see my students wanting to mess with them.
customer_reviews.author: Alegria

customer_reviews.title: Loved by all
customer_reviews.text: These were funded for my classroom through donorschoose.org and I must say all of my students want to sit on them all of the time. There is a race each class period for this limited resource. Students are able to sit at whichever angle they wish or they may actively wobble. These stools have helped my students stay focused for longer periods and stay engaged through our long school day.
customer_reviews.author: TexasMom

customer_reviews.title: Just as good of quality as the hokki stool
customer_reviews.text: Just as good of quality as the hokki stool, but less expensive. Also, much nicer than the Kore Wobble chair. I bought 2 Kore Wobble stools, 4 Hokki stools, and 4 of these and for the cost, I would recommend these for sure. The Kore stools are cheap for a reason and the hokki stools are crazy expensive! These are sturdy, great quality, and have the nonslip surface on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: These are great, very sturdy. I use it with my kinders, but got 18” so they are a little tall. They like having their feet dangle. I have a standing table that has 2 of these and two regular stools since we eat lunch in our rooms. Our third grade buddies love them even more and any visiting kiddos. Highly recommend for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Chani

customer_reviews.title: Flexible seating stools, which do not scratch the floor.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set I have purchased. My students love them! The stools do scratch fairly easily and the taller size will tip over! I love the rubber on the bottom so they don’t scratch your floors or make noise, when students ‘wobble’ on them.
customer_reviews.author: Anne R

customer_reviews.title: Great stools for school
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased as a Donor's Choose project. The stools are well made and durable. For bigger kids (5th graders) they are the best middle of the road height and work great. Our students love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and students love them
customer_reviews.text: My students love these! The stools allow them to move a little and get some energy out while they are working. I started out with six, and would like to add more in the future. They are made well, and it’s a good value
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: A class favorite
customer_reviews.text: My first grade students love these stools! They have held up pretty well except for the top. The rubber part seems to want to come off, but I keep a close eye on it and my students really do leave it alone. So far it's not come up.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Flexible Seating Chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2nd grade classroom!! My kids absolutely LOVE it. I LOVE it because it doesn't wobble as much as some wobble stools. It gives the students just enough wiggle room to move.
customer_reviews.author: Maegan

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! Love these! :)
customer_reviews.text: I love my Learniture wobble stools. They are sturdy enough to withstand daily classroom use. I also love the gripper on the bottom of the base. Other wobble stools I have tried are slippery and easy to slide off of but not these! I recommend this brand to anyone considering on purchasing wobble stools for their classroom! The price and quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah M.

customer_reviews.title: Not students pick
customer_reviews.text: I have two type of these stools. Students say seat is harder. This is the second year to use this stool and just found out the "pad" on seat came completely off. Haven't had this problem with my other brand.
customer_reviews.author: cwboan

customer_reviews.title: Cool wobble stools
customer_reviews.text: I've just completed my 3rd donorschoose for these stools in my middle school STEM classroom. I now have 12 stools total. They are very versitle, kids love them. They do not slip on the waxed floors which was a key for me choosing them versus other vendor stools. So far so good, my hope is that using them for a full year they will remain in prime condition under the duress of my MS kids.
customer_reviews.author: W Norton

customer_reviews.title: It fits nicely underneath his desk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14 year old son's room and he loves it. It fits nicely underneath his desk. I took off one star because it does get uncomfortable after sitting on it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as durable as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: My students love these! I just wish they were a little more durable. After having them for only a short amount of time, the black rubber mat piece game off on one of the two I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jenmharrison

customer_reviews.title: Perfect primary classroom alternative seating
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these for my classroom! My students love them and are the excited when it is their turn to have it for the day. I actually would like to purchase a talker one for my self at my work table. My only complaint is that the base gets really dusty from their shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Goodman

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied and the kids like them
customer_reviews.text: Half the price of "wobbly" stools and work almost as well. I'm satisfied and the kids like them. I did have to reglue the "seat" as the inset in only put in place with what appears to be double-stick tape but that was not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Hio

customer_reviews.title: Huge difference in attention span
customer_reviews.text: My son's teachers recommended this chair to help him focus. He has had it at school for a couple weeks now and his teachers are already commenting on his improved attention span. I will be purchasing another one of these chairs soon to keep at home for homework and study time. My son is in second grade, average height, if I were to order again I would go one size down.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair. Its small & can be used for an additional seat for company. It's comfortable & even if you don't have the wiggles you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wiggly Kids :)
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! Wiggly kids do so well with these. The 18” is great for 3-5 and the 15” for K-2
customer_reviews.author: Amanda F

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6th grade students
customer_reviews.text: I would pick a lighter color because the black shows dirt really badly. Overall, the stools are great and my students love sitting on them. I teach 11-12 year olds and the 18 inch stool is fine. I thought the 20 inch would be difficult to fit under the desks.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: LOVE them! They don't make noise
customer_reviews.text: I am a fifth grade teacher and we have 6 of these in our classroom. LOVE them! They don't make noise, they don't make marks on the floor, and they are super sturdy! I want four more!
customer_reviews.author: Cara Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: 20” is pretty high. I’m 5’7 and I could have gone down to the 18”. Overall satisfied. Watch for price and color drops and changes
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Sevin

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this chair for our existing kids table and my 5 year old son loves using it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: A Friedman

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: After a year with these in my classroom, I am very happy with my purchase. These stools held up well and I had no issues with the rubber top or anything else. My students liked them and I love that I can buy more of them compared to other high priced alternatives. I own 6 and will surely order 6 more when I can. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Claire R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for school!
customer_reviews.text: My second graders love these, and I love that the bottom is rubber (?). Whatever it is, it is not the same plastic as the base the Kore wobble chairs I have that, much to my custodian's dismay, scrapes the wax off the floor. These are also a smidge less expensive, which helps when you're considering them for a classroom on a teacher's salary.
customer_reviews.author: Velika Majka

customer_reviews.title: Wiggles without tipping.
customer_reviews.text: Wish they weren't so expensive! I would love these for my classroom. My kids love it to sit st the kitchen table while they do art work or writing. It has not tipped, which I appreciate because my other classroom stool do and make an awful sound.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Kay

customer_reviews.title: The teachers seem to be happy with it as well
customer_reviews.text: This has worked out really well for my son who is 9 and in the fourth grade. He was having a lot of trouble with messing around in his regular chair at school and kept tipping it over and being disruptive in class. This allows him to move around more and it has held up well. The teachers seem to be happy with it as well. It was priced alot better than some also. We have been very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly wobbly
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little over the weight limit , but it still holds my chunky butt fine.
customer_reviews.author: steven smigielski

customer_reviews.title: Great seat - High Priced
customer_reviews.text: This is a good seat for an active child. Very sturdy. Price is a little high for me but it came highly recommended..
customer_reviews.author: yourbbygirl1292

customer_reviews.title: Helps busy bodies sit still.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great. I got this for my child's desk in his room. He moves around a lot. He will stay in this chair because of the movement the chair does. It helps him stay focused
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids with attention difficulties
customer_reviews.text: Placed this in a middle school resource room and the kids love it. It help the kids remain in their seat and more importantly they have been getter more work done.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy W.

customer_reviews.title: My students love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 14 of these stools a few at a time. My students love them! The only problem we have had is the rubber covering on the seat has fallen out of two of them. We are still using the stools but it is a bit disappointing given the price. I would recommend these stools over the Kore brand if you have linoleum floors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classroom Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This is my students' favorite flexible seating chair. In a structured classroom, it provides just the right amount of movement to help students stay focused and on task, without needing to be up and around the classroom all the time. They were the perfect size for my second graders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Classroom!
customer_reviews.text: Students AND teachers use these stools. They are the perfect addition for my students!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highlight of the Day!
customer_reviews.text: I have one learning stool (15in) in my5th grade classroom and decided to order another one after seeing how much the kids enjoyed it. I got a taller one (18in) for the taller students. They were so excited when we got the box in and they loved the blue color. After they all tried it, the most common response is that is more wobbly than the shorter one. Never heard so many "thank you's!" We are happy!
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Wobble, Twist, and stay in the seat.
customer_reviews.text: Love these stools. My kids use them and are more relaxed to read.
customer_reviews.author: Jenay

customer_reviews.title: My 5th grade students love these stools
customer_reviews.text: My 5th grade students love these stools! I will be purchasing two more for my classroom this year as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Teacher Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I buy a few of these every year. My students love them. They're durable, sturdy, and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: Great for active students! Be careful with the top...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these stools last fall. They do exactly what they are meant to do...they allow students to move while still seated. The students love them! My goal was to slowly get a couple at a time as I could afford them. (The price is so great compared to other brands of similar stools!) However, after about 6 months, the top textured part came off of one of the stools. :( By May, the 2nd one had also come apart. I haven't yet tried to fix them...summer project. I had hoped that they would stay intact for longer than this...still debating about a repeat purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Wobble while you learn
customer_reviews.text: My students love these stools! I just had to get use to them squirming. They have no problem focusing on what is in front of them. I have had teachers ask to borrow them to check them out before buying their own, and the kids all love them!
customer_reviews.author: katherine l. Nester

customer_reviews.title: Love these stools
customer_reviews.text: Love these stools. My third graders love to sit on them. I will be teaching first grade next year. They might be a tad tall but they will grow into them just fine. I definitely need more then 4.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using in sixth grade classroom.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using them in my classroom for about 6 weeks now. So far, so good. The kids love them!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen M Briggs

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this stool
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this stool!! I have 5 students and they wait patiently for their turn to use it. I promised I would buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: J kahl

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for !
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store and compact for my small desk area! I am 5'3 and 120 was looking for an affordable wiggly chair as I like to call it! Helps me stay focused and makes me think of my posture !
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable stool
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It’s a great chair and wonderful having it in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Myrna Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 20+ for my classroom. They’ve held up well over two years!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Ward

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Whether for children or as an alternative to typical seating
customer_reviews.author: Hendythehalfwit

customer_reviews.title: My 4th grade students like it. However
customer_reviews.text: My 4th grade students like it. However, it isn't 15 inches like stated. It is 14 inches, the same as other similar stools. This has better grip for children's bottoms on the stool, but the other wobble stools actually wobble more. Nice to have the 2 kinds for kids to choose which they prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wiggles !
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in Kindergarten! They are great for students who have a difficult time sitting still .
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Sellers Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Active seating
customer_reviews.text: These work well for students in grades K and I. Much better than using the stability balls in my claas. The only downside is that the mat fell off the top but we glued it back on ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy chidlren
customer_reviews.text: The children love this stool. Works very well for them.
customer_reviews.author: Dorthy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our K-2 students love these, and they pay attention better when they can move in their seats.
customer_reviews.author: AB1966

customer_reviews.title: My fifth grade students like it just fine as a seating option
customer_reviews.text: This is a less expensive version of the others. My fifth grade students like it just fine as a seating option. I think it is less comfortable that the other version.
customer_reviews.author: teachcurious

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality stool. Unfortunately, my energetic homeschooler doesn't find sitting on a rocking stool as satisfying as standing and moving around, which I could have had her do without buying a stool. I'm just saying it isn't the answer for every active child. Those who have tried other stools might like that this one has a rubbery, nonslip bottom. It won't slip around on hardwood floors. However, this means that you can't scoot in extremely easily, either, because it doesn't slide on the floor. It can't be both ways, of course, and I prefer the nonslip overall.
customer_reviews.author: Imfree

customer_reviews.title: They allow students to move and they students enjoy sitting on them
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my small groups. They allow students to move and they students enjoy sitting on them. This is great for busy students.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia jones

customer_reviews.title: Classroom essential
customer_reviews.text: My students love these! I also have Hooki stools which are more expensive and essentially the same so I’d buy these again for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I teach in a developmental preschool these are far better than Kore stools
customer_reviews.text: I teach in a developmental preschool these are far better than Kore stools. They have a rubber bottom so they do not slip on either carpet or linoleum. Also not as easy to spin or tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy, comfortable. It will be great for my students....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea...
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for my 8 year old grandson. He has one in school and loves it...so has to have one for home too..
customer_reviews.author: C. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seat
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for my daughter to manage herself in the classroom great seat option
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My students love these. I have several and just ordered 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I love these stools
customer_reviews.text: I love these stools! They help maximize my classroom space and students love them! I have 1st through 4th graders using them and the size seems to work for all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far it is holding up to my students using it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product! My son uses it at school and it has helped him so much! We are thinking of ordering another one from hone 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Amypk

customer_reviews.title: I'm a special education teacher and these stools were perfect for my 3/4 graders
customer_reviews.text: I'm a special education teacher and these stools were perfect for my 3/4 graders. They get to wobble while they work. These stools are well made and durable for when working at the table. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Marie Oberlin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: We love this product at our school! Each year we have requests from more teachers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun alternative
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well built for classroom use. My students are enjoying them as flexible seating options!
customer_reviews.author: Geri Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My kiddos LOVE it. It is durable and is just the right height.
customer_reviews.author: christin

customer_reviews.title: teacher's choice
customer_reviews.text: I saw the kids used it today so they must really like it.
customer_reviews.author: PDUBSNY

customer_reviews.title: and my students really like this. It's very sturdy and well-built
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for a semester, and my students really like this. It's very sturdy and well-built.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right amount of wobbliness
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these stools in my classroom and love them, so do the students! They are very durable and don't show any wear and tear. They also come already assembled - BONUS! They wobble just the right amount. Some wobble chairs wobble way too much and these are just right.
customer_reviews.author: Kari M Gilbertson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My students love these and are able to focus more and behaviors have decreased.
customer_reviews.author: Casie Mort

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The kids my wife works with love them, and use them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Pust

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my class
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my little 2nd grade wigglers. I wasn't sure which size to order, but the 18" works for all but the very shortest.
customer_reviews.author: ShelbyC.

customer_reviews.title: I bought the wrong size but also it did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the wrong size but also it did not move as much as another product and if you sit for a long time the seat becomes very hard.
customer_reviews.author: sandra  bouman

customer_reviews.title: I could not love this product any more
customer_reviews.text: I could not love this product any more. I wish I could make the black seat stay on but that is a miniscule problem :)
customer_reviews.author: Mendota Elementary- c/o Kerri Lintl

customer_reviews.title: but students love this chair
customer_reviews.text: Only bought one due to price, but students love this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: It has been a great tool for him
customer_reviews.text: It has been an effective tool for one of my students. He can sit on it and move his upper body. It has been a great tool for him.

customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old nephew loves it!! I also have many of these stools in my classroom,which my students love!!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My students love it!! It is very sturdy for my second grade students!! Just enough movement!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Fagundes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST! The kids love them and don't have to sit still while on them.

product_meta.title: Learniture Active Learning Chair/ Stool, 18" H, Black, LNT-3046-18BK
product_meta.description: Size:18 inch| Color:BlackKeep wiggly young students comfortable with the active Learning stool from Learniture. The textured, non-slip thermoplastic rubber bottom is curved to allow a wide range of movement without disrupting the Class. Plus, the backless design encourages proper posture while strengthening core muscles. The polypropylene shell is easy to clean and a lightweight design makes mobility and storage simple.
feature_bullets: Keep students comfortable with the Active Learning Stool from Learniture
The textured, non-slip thermoplastic rubber bottom is curved to allow a wide range of movement without disrupting the class.
The backless design encourages proper posture while strengthening core muscles.
Easy-to-clean polypropylene shell, is GREENGUARD [GOLD] Certified for improving indoor air quality by reducing chemical pollutants
Recommended for 9 years and older- weight capacity 250 lbs.
